ResourceHeader.Description:
AJ4CO Observatory in High Springs, Florida is a
   participant in the Radio JOVE project providing observations of
   radio emissions from Jupiter, the Sun, and the Galactic Background
   to other members of the Radio JOVE community. The observatory
   consists of a TFD (Terminated Folded Dipole) array and a Radio JOVE
   dipole array which feed a variety of receiver systems including a
   Dual-Polarization Spectrograph (DPS), a Tunable Wideband Receiver
   (TWB), a FS-200B radio spectrograph, and Radio JOVE receivers.

   The TFD array consists of two square arrays on a NS line, eight
   30-foot TFD elements with beam steering in 5 degree increments NS
   and 15 degree increments EW.

InformationURL.Name: Radio JOVE Spectrograph Users Group (SUG)
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the Radio JOVE project

InformationURL.Name: AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Publications
InformationURL.Description:
This site provides descriptions of radio receiver
    systems at AJ4CO as well as other radio astronomy-related
    documentation

InformationURL.Name: AJ4CO Miscellaneous Data
InformationURL.Description:
This site provides descriptions of radio receiver
    systems at AJ4CO, observation logs and other documentation
